This is a book that is difficult to resist; the writing is sublime. Michelle Obama has a way with words; this is one of the most fascinating and informative books I have read this year. There is a great deal to admire about Michelle Obama. Some of her success was due to luck, but most is due to her intelligence and her hard work. As a woman and a Black woman, she had to work three times as hard as a man, and she proved her worth. Michelle Obama tells us she is writing this book to inspire the next generation. She knows how important role models are, especially for young women of color in a culture that isn‚Äôt changing fast enough. She says in her book, 'Here I am, I have got a lot to say.' Her book is divided into three sections: 'Becoming Me,' 'Becoming Us,' and 'Becoming More.' What we find in these pages is a woman opening herself and her world to us. This is a book so well written, with such honesty and integrity, I felt like I was trusted with her secrets. She starts by talking about her upbringing, her life in Chicago, a family who showed such love and at the same time showed her that using her intellect to move herself forward was the right path. Off to Princeton where she was a minority for the first time, learning to navigate in a white world. Then to Harvard to study law and her first job, where she met her future husband, Barack Obama. Then the life of a married woman, working full-time, wanting a family and finally succeeding via in vitro fertilization. Her husband was into politics and was often not home, so Michelle was the parent. Some resentment and couples therapy helped them through their rough spots. Political life is difficult, and the statements by some were hurtful, and she names names. The scrutiny and constraints were a lesson she quickly learned and went on to become one of the most beloved First Ladies. Now, Michelle Obama has her real life back, and she is discovering who she wants to be. Malia and Sasha are settling into their lives with plans of their own. Michelle Obama has no love for politics and she will never seek a political office. Michelle, Barack, and the girls are looking toward the future. Michelle Obama is telling the truth of her life; she grew up surrounded by love in a city, Chicago, she loves, onward to an education that took her far. She has everything she wanted, family, a husband she loves, and now she is looking at her next adventure. An autobiography I urge everyone to read. This is a book of the year.

‚ÄúI thought she did a really good job of showing us the human side of who she and Barack were. Just like *Hillbilly Elegy* by J.D. Vance, this book shows us how some Americans 'make it' from the ground up, but that it‚Äôs not easy. Making it is a quicksilver process, requiring such ingredients as intelligence, timing, hard work, luck, and happenstance. It‚Äôs scary how many things can impede the chances of good, smart kids. Michelle Obama chronicles how she managed to make it, and she deserved her good fortune, but she would be the first to tell you a lot of it wasn‚Äôt up to her. This makes you sad about all the kids left behind, or let‚Äôs be honest: all the kids who are murdered before they can fulfill their potential. Obama is frank with kids who‚Äôre struggling against the odds, and in this as in so many other issues, she doesn‚Äôt get down and helpless over the burdens. She encourages us to accept what is and work around it. I found that empowering. Her description of meeting and getting to know, then falling in love with, Barack is really interesting. It was NOT love at first sight! They became friends, then sweethearts, and then, over time, deeply in love. We get to see what Barack is like‚Äîtruly, that‚Äôs the stellar aspect of this book; it‚Äôs so candid! Michelle isn‚Äôt afraid to complain and speak honestly; she struggles as a young adult and a working mother, then as a political spouse. You really see the sausage-works of political campaigns. The book wasn‚Äôt gripping, but it was interesting. I‚Äôve always thought she was super-smart and clever, and that seems true, but when she mentions she‚Äôs not overly introspective, I found that hard to believe. However, by the end of the book, I wondered if it was true because she minimized some events in her life that would have been compelling had she gone deeper. She was the first/only black woman to do X, Y, and Z. I feel quite sure she ran into a lot more obstacles than she shares, and in that sense, she kind of minimizes her astronomical climb. How many kids from the hood get into Princeton and Harvard, and then succeed as well as she did? And when she got hired at the white-shoe law firm, what did that really feel like? Ah, well. A missed opportunity. There is so much to like about this book, the little vignettes about life in the White House, for example. The policy issues were less interesting; the human issues more so. ‚ÄúFirst of all, I‚Äôm happy to report that I‚Äôm writing this review AFTER I read the book, and it‚Äôs not completely based on my past and present political views. With that being said, I didn‚Äôt completely love the book. I was expecting Michelle Obama to be a little less guarded in it and go a little deeper into her personal thoughts and struggles; to be a little bit more candid. I also wanted to find out more about life in the White House. On all of those fronts, this book mostly doesn‚Äôt deliver. Mrs. Obama is an incredibly intelligent woman, and on top of that, she is a lawyer with an Ivy League education. That background has largely influenced this book, which feels like it‚Äôs been edited for any possibility of risky statements or disclosures. It feels too safe, too guarded to really be authentic. She focuses a lot on presenting a very clean version of her life (her family was perfect; it was loving and supportive, her mom was without any faults, her father was equally perfect and he handled his disability with pride and no complaints). Is that realistic? While her family must‚Äôve been quite amazing, and I‚Äôm sure she loved it very much, nothing and no one is really perfect. I just couldn‚Äôt buy it. For some reason, she barely mentions Harvard. She goes into quite a bit of detail about being a black woman at Princeton, but she dedicates maybe half a page in the book to her time at Harvard, mostly talking about how she didn‚Äôt have time to reflect on what she wanted to do in life during the intense studies to obtain her law degree. That‚Äôs it. It made me very curious about what happened at Harvard and why she or Harvard itself didn‚Äôt want that to be in the book. She is clear about not liking politics and not really wanting to be in politics, but provides very little insight into how she transformed from that stage to seeming to really enjoy being the First Lady (she was terrified Barack Obama wouldn‚Äôt be elected for the second term). She mentions very little about her marital struggles. She does say at some point they went to counseling, but again, it‚Äôs a brief mention and ends at that. She seems to describe nothing but marital bliss after that. I did appreciate that she mentioned having a miscarriage, having to go through IVF to conceive, failing her bar exam on the first try, and getting into Harvard from a waiting list. But I did notice one thing about the tone of the book: Michelle Obama is determined not to focus on anything negative. She mentions her miscarriage very briefly and almost dismissively by saying that they‚Äôre very common and happen to more women than we all think. That again takes about half a page to a full page. Her IVF is mentioned, but again quite briefly. She describes her life almost with a sense of distance at times, focusing on events not feelings or emotions. There were a few passages of the book that felt more personal, and I enjoyed them. The part where she says she skipped the final ball of the inauguration night (the one she was most looking forward to) because she was simply too exhausted to go. There is a part where she writes about Sasha thinking that nobody came to see Barack Obama‚Äôs acceptance speech the night of the first election because the streets were empty, and that in that moment she realized that they were empty because now they were traveling with the President Elect. She describes how it felt to see for the first time the heavy security surrounding her husband when he became president with the massive helicopters, motorcade, snipers, secret agents, etc. That gave me goosebumps. I enjoyed reading about that tender moment when Malia got an ear infection on vacation in Hawaii and when Barack Obama had to choose between leaving her and Michelle alone to travel back home to cast an important vote in the Senate or staying with his family (which did need him). I was disappointed that she didn‚Äôt write about how life has been after leaving the White House. Yes, there is that one toast she made, but other than that, it‚Äôs mostly undisclosed in the book. Do they miss it? Do they get to enjoy their lives now more? What‚Äôs next for them (other than creating a foundation in Chicago)? The book doesn‚Äôt talk about that. In summary, I do recommend the book. Michelle Obama is a good writer, and she is likable. She writes about race, family life, being a working mother, friendships, and politics. It‚Äôs still an interesting read, if not a little bit too safe.‚Äù

The 1925 COBRA was among Valentino's last films--and it tends to divide the star's fans, who either rejoice at his appearance in a realistic drama or yearn for something that rivals his earlier, often outrageous seductive melodramas. The story concerns Count Rodrigo Torriani (Valentino), an impoverished Italian nobleman with a penchant for torrid affairs that lead to endless and often monetary difficulties. Largely in order to escape such difficulties, Rodrigo agrees to work for American antiques dealer Jack Dorning (Casson Ferguson)--only to find himself little better off in New York, where he wavers between office secretary Mary Drake (Gertrude Olmstead) and Jack's femme fatale wife Elise (Nita Naldi.) In a stylistic sense, COBRA shows what Valentino could do as an actor when he was not encumbered by the usual 'great seducer' scripts pressed upon him--and he acquits himself very well. The supporting cast, most particularly Naldi, is also excellent. But there is no two ways about it: COBRA is so low-key that it feels excessively slow as it moves toward its none-too-surprising conclusion. The film itself is beautiful to the eye. Valentino is very close to the height of his physical appeal and Naldi is stunningly beautiful in a series of Adrian-designed gowns; the art direction by William Cameron Menzies is excellent, and the cinematography by Fischbeck and Jennings has a velvety quality that is quite fine. Even so, and with a running time of just over an hour, COBRA feels excessively languid in tone. The DVD offers a handsome transfer and good music score, but little else. Recommended--but primarily for hardcore Valentino fans.

It is very rare that we can get to pick all three - as in this case. I purchased this item (Transcend M5 Multi Card Reader) because I need to read/write high-capacity SDHC cards, and my old card reader (Lexar Media RW022-001) is unable to recognize them. So far, I have tested the Transcend M5 with many different brands of CF and SD/SDHC cards, and it worked flawlessly. Just for fun, I also benchmarked several CF and SD cards in both my new Transcend M5 and old Lexar reader. I'm surprised to find out that the card reader actually makes a big difference in the data transfer rate.

For example: when I benchmarked the SanDisk 2GB Ultra II CF Card in my old Lexar reader, I received a rather disappointing write speed of 4.1MB/S (equivalent to '27x'). But the same card in the new Transcend M5 gave me a write speed of 5.9MB/S (equivalent to '40x'). That's nearly 50% faster data transfer rate! Other CF and SD cards tested also showed similar performance boosts. (Note that Sandisk claims the Ultra II CF is capable of 15MB/S, but that's the maximum speed under optimal test condition.) In summary, the Transcend M5 card reader is very inexpensive, gives a much faster data rate than my old card reader, and seems to be very well-constructed. That makes it an excellent buy in my book.

This package includes four rechargeable NiMH batteries (2x AA + 2x AAA) plus a simple charger. The batteries are the new Rayovac 'Hybrid', which are advertised to have a very low self-discharge rate similar to the better-known Sanyo Eneloop. The capacity of the Hybrid AA cell is rated at 2100mAh, slightly higher than that for the Eneloop (2000mAh). I have tested both brands and can confirm that their ratings are accurate. The Hybrid AAA cells, however, were tested to be slightly lower than the rated 800mAh capacity. In my 5-month self-discharge test, Sanyo Eneloop retained about 85% capacity, while Hybrid kept about 80%. For all practical applications, the two brands are equally good. So the Rayovac Hybrid could be a better value - if you can find it at a lower price than Eneloop. The charger included in this package, however, is a piece of junk. It is a timer-based dumb charger that simply charges for 8 hours at around 350mA and then turns off (obviously it was designed to charge 2500-2700mAh cells, because 350*8=2800). It also forces you to charge cells in pairs. Both 'features' are bad for your batteries. The charger included in the Sanyo Eneloop package is 'smart', in the sense that it charges each cell independently, and stops when each cell is full. If you are looking for a travel charger that is smart, compact, and reasonably fast, I highly recommend the KODAK K6200.

I went back and forth a few times to get the right size and the caps are still tight. Nothing I hate more than losing the rubber cap on a perfectly good set of headphones! The only complaint I could have with these is that the cord is a little short. I am 5'11 and the cord barely reaches the mp3 player in my pants pocket. However, this makes for a nice little compact package when wrapped up so it is not that bad at all. I would recommend buying these all day long
Just received the headphone. The used material is really good. Also the sound is very good. The bluetooth connection worked also quickly with the english guide. Untill so far very OK!

This is an excellent review of many important topics of Astronomy. Some astronomy resources can be too elementary and suffer from lack of rigor, while some resources for astrophysics and cosmology can be poorly written (terrible explanations of topics) and very daunting. This Schaum‚Äôs Outline for Astronomy by Stacey Palen is well-written, with excellent and succinct explanations of sometimes difficult topics. Illustrations throughout the book support the concepts that are covered and the calculations are well-explained and accessible. Five stars. Definitely recommended for students of astronomy!

I hooked this up to my wife's computer yesterday and almost sent it back DOA. I hit the power button on the back several times and it wouldn't turn on. I even checked to make sure there was power in the end of the plug that goes into the monitor. As I was fussing with it, my wife came over and hit some of the other buttons on the back such as brightness, contrast, etc. and it came to life! I find that strange & pretty much unacceptable. After it started showing the home screen and browsing a bit we didn't think the color was all that great. It had a too bright look to it. After messing with the brightness and contrast we have it looking better (let's say acceptable), but certainly not great or even very good. For a better inexpensive monitor I'd recommend checking out a comparable Spectre monitor. Not recommended for a number¬†of¬†reasons.
Fantastic reading can't put it down!!
This was a very good buy. A happy 3-year-old insisted on having his Christmas dinner from it. The cutlery was just the right size for him to manage.
A good quality set of tools. The bamboo is solid and of very high quality with no flaws or splinters. The edges are crisp and well defined. Overall a very good set of wok tools.

This is a very easy to use and accurate detector. You simply hold it against the wall and switch it on. At first, the screen shows a series of instructions on how to use the detector. You then select what you want to detect and slide the device from side to side. There is sound, a picture on the display, and the coloured ring changes colour when something is detected. You can then mark the position through the hole in the detector.

None of these detectors are totally foolproof and do take a bit of getting used to as there is an art. They also work better on newer houses with regular thickness walls. In my experience, I use multiple passes at different heights of the wall to ensure that I have found what I am looking for. This one seems to cope as well as my other Bosch professional detector, but this has the added bonus of the easy-to-use display.

I would have liked a case to have been included for protection when not in use, and the back of the detector is just hard plastic so it can mark the walls if you are heavy-handed, but as a detector, this does do the job very well.

This is a very effective product suitable for the home user or semi-professional. Not much bigger than a mobile phone it is easy to use - just switch on and within a second or two the image is displayed on the screen. There are buttons for lamp brightness, image rotation, and photo capture and playback. The camera wand is permanently fixed to the unit and is semi-flexible such that you bend it into shape and it stays that way.

Image quality is good enough for almost any use. It focuses down to a couple of centimetres and the light is bright enough to see things at a good distance. The image capture works well - I have included a couple of photos to show the detail - the unit stores up to 8 images locally or you can add a 4-32 meg SD card for more capacity or to transfer the photos off the unit. The screen is clear and bright enough but if you use it outdoors then you will struggle.

There are a couple of attachments which include a 90-degree mirror and a magnet which is strong enough to pick up a fork so will manage a lost nut or key with no problems. These fit securely and easily and store in the included pouch.
Overall, this is a well-designed and very handy device to have around the house, or in the toolbox.

It took me about twenty minutes or so to put this together single-handedly. It would have taken a few minutes less but the instructions are in very small print and one of the bags of parts was mislabelled so caused a bit of confusion.
The design is good, it stands firmly on the floor and there is no wobble. Plenty of space for stuff with deep shelves and the double rail.

However, the double rail does cause a problem for me - as my shirts are all extra large or bigger, the lower rail is about six inches too high and means that the shirts do not hang straight. This rail can be removed but as it only goes in one place you are then left with a single rail wardrobe. Not a big problem but a bit annoying.
Overall, though, this is a sturdy enough wardrobe with plenty of space.
This cable addresses a very common problem in my house of broken charging leads due to poor strain relief design and general misuse.

The cable looks good - the colour matches the body of popular phones. The design and build quality are also good - longer strain relief areas and reinforced connectors. The cable feels flexible but durable.
In use, it works as fast as the stock Samsung cable for both charging and data transfer.
So overall this cable looks good and performs well with the added bonus of extra durability so I can highly recommend it.

The products contained inside the set are all of the normal high Baylis And Harding quality. They smell nice and work well on the body and there is certainly enough in here for a few weekends away. The bag looks nice, but obviously, at this price, it is made from leather-effect material and is probably not durable enough to use as an everyday bag.

As a gift set it is okay as it stands, but the products inside are wrapped in scraps of white tissue and held in place with tatty corrugated cardboard, so you may consider rewrapping the contents to make it look a bit more special.
Overall, though, this is indeed a nice gift set suitable for a few weekends away.

The hardest thing about using this kit was getting the timing right. On our first attempt at a trial nail we didn't quite wait long enough to apply the top coat and the whole thing went wrong. But after this initial fail, we managed to get a brilliant look every time. Even for a novice, it is easy and the effect is very striking.
I would have liked proper instructions - the only ones are written on the back of the box - but otherwise this is a very easy-to-use kit to get a very striking effect.
Put simply, this is a 1-meter strip of covered LEDs with a sticky back and an integrated plug and control unit which allows you to select brightness and colour by using one of two buttons.

It works very well. The light it provides is bright and there are a good range of vivid colours. You can trim the length if you so wish. The adhesive sticks to almost any surface and holds the lights firmly. The coating on the strip means that it is easily wipe-cleanable.
I would have liked the cable to be longer and more flexible - you are limited in placement options and the white-coloured wire is quite visible due to its thickness.

There are cheaper options, but in my experience, you do get what you pay for to a certain extent. The moulded cable and integrated power supply on this mean that it is more durable and safer than most of the cheaper options.
Overall, then, I do like this strip. It does exactly as advertised but could do with a longer cable.

The results from this cooker are nothing short of amazing. Plenty of videos and guides online will show you how to use it to cook the best steaks you have tasted. Easily and cleanly. We have done expensive steaks, cheap steaks, a roast joint of beef, belly pork, fruit compote, soups and much more. It's a brilliant way to cook stuff.

To use it you seal your food in a plastic bag (we bought a vacuum sealer and bags for this but you can use freezer bags if you like) then set the temperature and time and leave it. The food cooks to the desired temperature and then stays there. So for steaks or roast, you choose exactly how you like it done and then forget about it. When it comes to serving, remove it from the bag and sear it in a pan or the oven and you are done.

The only issue I have with this is that it will not connect to my WiFi. I have tried Android and iOS apps, restarting everything multiple times, but in the end, I gave up. It isn't really a big issue as setting time and temperature is easy enough from the device itself, and the app works without a connection, but it is still a flaw.
However, overall this is a very effective device that cooks many foods to perfection with very little fuss. Recommended.
This is a decent Lego kit. It took me just over four hours to complete it, although for half an hour I was also talking to Three customer services so you could maybe shave a bit of time off that.

The instructions are clear and very easy to understand, and at no point did I get confused or put things in the wrong place. The parts come in eight bags, with each bag being opened when directed in the instructions. This means that it is easy enough to find the right bits - at least for the first assembly. I am a bit disappointed that Lego no longer includes chocolate box style inserts in the box to separate the pieces for storage. No pieces were missing, although I did have a few extras (see photos). A disassembly tool is included which works very well and saves your fingernails.

The set includes a few action figures in case it is to be used for play, although it does feel a bit flimsy to be played with as a toy. The arms and fingers move and the missile launcher thingys open up and you can launch them with a flick of your finger. Despite having just the one wheel there is an innocuous brace behind that which allows it to stand unaided.
Overall this is a good set, probably more for display than play. And if you take it apart then it will probably take longer to reassemble than initially due to the numbered bags.

This product works well. You charge it up using a standard micro USB cable - which is included in the box - then switch it on and cycle between heat, heat and light, and heat, light, and sonic modes. Then you just gently move it around clean and lightly moisturised eyes to stimulate the blood flow and hopefully reduce bags and dark rings.

It feels nice. Once you have the technique then it is a relaxing experience. Time will tell how effective it is, and this will vary per person, but using heat and vibration to stimulate blood flow to an area is a proven technique.

These headphones are a bit more of a job to set up than most as they need an optical connection from the rear of the PS4 to the dongle to get the full surround. This also means that you will not get full surround unless the device you are connecting to has an optical output so if you are buying these for a PC then check carefully.

The instructions are clear and easy to understand with screenshots of the relevant screens from the PS4 to help with the setup. All cables are included and are of very good quality, as is the build quality of the headphones themselves.

In use, I found the sound to be good for gaming but not the best I have heard. The surround works very well depending upon the support from your game and adds a lot of atmosphere. In multiplayer shooters, it can give you an edge as you can sometimes hear an enemy long before you see them. There are lots of midrange and highs but I find the bass a bit lacking. The microphone is good.
They are reasonably comfortable but the vinyl ear cups did mean I got a bit hot after a while.
Overall, I like these phones. The audio quality could be better but the surround sound works very well. Just check that these are compatible if you are considering them for anything other than a PS4.

This set of shampoo, conditioner, and spray has been very well received by my daughter. She has long, fine hair and loves the extra volume and shine that she gets when using the set. The bonus is that this all comes in a really substantial-sized gift set ready for Christmas.

The idea of having a juicer and a zester in one is a good one. And this product does both things very well. The reamer fits well in your hand and is comfortable enough to use - although a little bit harder than a reamer with a built-in strainer and bowl. The zester is very efficient and does a great job of removing the zest. And the whole thing is dishwasher safe and fits neatly into any kitchen drawer. Recommended.

My daughter loves this product. She has long, fine hair and regularly straightens it so it does get very dry and fly away. Recently she has been using pure coconut oil, but finds that this product smells better and leaves her hair a lot softer and with a nice shine. Highly recommended.

I loved the rebooted adult Penguin books and have the whole set. For me, this book tries to do the same thing, but falls very short of the mark. It is very disjointed and the humour jumps around too much for there to be any flow to the 'story'. I won't be reading any of the others in the series.

A nicely presented gift set, albeit in a very flimsy box, of a decent range of Dove products. The body wash smells nice and leaves the skin clean and soft. The body lotion complements the wash well and leaves the skin even softer. The deodorant is non-irritating on gentle skin. And the final part of the set is a reasonable quality bag to keep all the stuff in for traveling. Recommended.

This is a very nice, very heavy-duty baking tray with air holes to help crisp up your food. It works very well - biscuits, pizza, and chips are all made more crispy by the holes allowing condensation to escape. The non-stick works too, cleaning by hand is a breeze. As a tip - because the pan is thicker than normal then I found it works best pre-heated otherwise it takes a long time to warm and start to cook the food.

This is a high-quality stainless steel cocktail shaker with a very different brass and matte black finish. It comes with a strainer and a measuring cup. The body join has a silicone seal and fits together firmly whilst the lid just presses on, similar to other shakers. There is an integral coarse strainer under the lid for large ice cubes and so on. The finish looks to be durable as long as the hand-wash-only instructions are followed.
Overall this is a very nice looking and well-performing set.

The pins on this gauge are a lot finer than my previous (plastic) contour gauge, which means that it has a lot higher resolution. This allows for a very accurate copy of your template item. However, the pins on mine are very stiff, needing a considerable amount of force to be moved. While this does ensure that the design is retained, it does mean that it takes a lot of force against the object to be copied to get the pins to move, so much so that it left an imprint on my plaster coving. It may wear in over time, and I have added some oil to help it along, but for now, it only gets three stars.

I am a big fan of bits and pieces of useless information, so for years, I have enjoyed books full of the stuff. This book is therefore currently at the top of my reading list when I have a few minutes to sit down with not much else to entertain me. Each page has a selection of short anecdotes, facts, or stories related to food. Most of them are one or two sentences long, and almost all of them are eyebrow-raisers.
Reading it in one go is not recommended as fact overload sets in very quickly, but to pick up and put down a couple of times a day, this is a great book.

This cable is slightly thicker than the stock USB cable included with my Galaxy S8 and is therefore slightly less flexible. It also follows the current trend of having non-existent strain relief so will need to be treated with care. However, on the upside, it is a lot longer than my stock cable and performs as well as the stock cable. And all backed up by the Belkin name.
Recommended.

This is a smart-looking and very effective device that has allowed me to connect my Samsung Galaxy S8 to my TV via HDMI. I simply plugged in the HDMI cable and attached it to my phone to mirror the display almost instantly. There is very little lag which allows me to show photos, videos, games, and more. The cable is about 10 cm long and reasonably flexible, and the whole thing rolls up into a space not much larger than a USB stick, which allows me to carry one device to and from work instead of a selection of USB sticks.
Be aware that this will not work on every USB-C device - my Galaxy A5 wasn't compatible - but otherwise I highly recommend it.

This pole doesn‚Äôt do the job very well. It is made of aluminium so feels very solid and durable but is quite a bit heavier than plastic poles. Although this does mean that it is a lot more stable and potentially will take more abuse. When extended it feels equally solid, and the camera is controllable with a good amount of precision. The extension part of the pole is satin black to minimise glare. The remote is held firmly in position and is in the right place for finger or thumb operation, although it is a bit rotated from the camera when the pole is locked at its full extent, but you do get used to this. I‚Äôm very happy with it.

A nice looking large-sized pan which has a handy clear lid and silicone non-slip handles. The pan heats up quickly and evenly on my induction hob and is oven and dishwasher safe. The pan feels a bit on the thin and tinny side, but the base is thick and does the whole thing works very well. It is also backed up by a five-year guarantee. Recommended.

This is an excellent cleaner with very powerful suction and highly effective filtration, which means that there is no doggy smell from the carpets when cleaning up after pets. It is made from very high-quality components that feel like they will last for years. The design is good too - the unit is compact and relatively light so it follows you around with minimum effort, relieving pressure on your arms and wrists compared to an upright. Suction is amazing - at full power it sticks to the carpet and is quite hard to move around - but there is a pressure relief valve on the handle to release anything you inadvertently suck up like a rug without switching off the power.

It comes with a good selection of tools - in addition to a bristle brush, extension nozzle, and mini head, you also get a long flexible nozzle for under furniture or behind car seats and a hard floor head for ensuring very effective cleaning of vinyl or laminates. The cable is long enough to do almost the whole floor of a house without changing sockets and retracts smoothly with the press of a foot.

It does have the downside of requiring replacement bags which will cost money, but as I said before, this is balanced by the more effective filtration and smell removal over bagless cleaners. And the lack of a rotating brush does mean that dog hairs take a few passes to remove. But overall this is a very powerful and effective cleaner.
This is a very well-designed and built cleaner that has high-quality durable components.

It has been a while since I used a cleaner with a bag as opposed to bagless and I was pleasantly surprised. The suction is very good. So much so that it can be hard to move it across the carpet on full power. There is also less of a smell than when using bagless cleaners - we have two dogs and I currently live in an old house where the previous occupants had six dogs - and the smell from a bagless can be quite overpowering after a few minutes. The filtration seems to be a lot better at removing said canine odours. Cleaning performance is good but the lack of a rotating brush does mean that dog hairs take a few passes to remove.

It comes with a good selection of attachments - a small brush, a crevice nozzle, and a mini head for furniture or car seats. All of these bits store securely at the base of the pipe. The pipe itself is thick and durable - unlike our latest bagless - and long enough to almost do a full flight of stairs. There is a pressure relief valve on the handle to release sucked up rugs without having to switch off the power. The cable retracts with the press of a foot and there is a place to store the handle with the cleaner upright so it does not take up too much space. The rotating casters mean that the base unit follows easily around the house so overall there is a lot less stress on your wrists than when using an upright.

Overall, this is a very good cleaner. Quality and performance are good and the components are durable. It is quite expensive and will require replacement bags, but the balance is that in my opinion, the filtration is better than with a bagless.

A very handy-sized container which has proper hinges instead of bending plastic and rubber seals so that it will keep the damp from your ingredients. It is freezer, microwave, and dishwasher safe. There is really nothing to fault with this container. I will be buying more.

Overall, this is a good product. The chain is quite thick but relatively light. It is protected (and your paint is protected from the chain) by a thick fabric. The five-digit combination is easy to set to your own numbers and clicks easily into place. There is enough space between the dials to make setting the number easy. The chain is just long enough to go through your bike and frame and still attach to a close pole or railing.
The only downside is that the plastic of the lock part itself is very sharp, so careful placement on your bike is required so that this doesn‚Äôt damage your paint.
It is quite a simple idea - just photos of dogs catching treats (with a one-page introduction and a few pages showing the names of the dogs) but everyone who has looked at this book loves it.

It isn‚Äôt particularly long, and you can leaf through it in a few minutes, but it is still good nonetheless. Certainly worth flipping through every now and again when you have a few minutes or need cheering up.

The clear instructions meant that this headset was easy to set up on my PS4. Build quality is very good, with strong-feeling hinges and springy bits. The design is also very good - they are comfortable and everything is well laid out with controls easy to find and the microphone folding away well when not in use. Prolonged use didn‚Äôt lead to pressure sores or overheating of my ears. Audio quality is excellent - deep bass and crisp highs, with little leakage so you can play at volume without annoying others in the room. When you select the superhuman mode it really does highlight significant sounds such as footsteps or reloading - a bit of an unfair advantage some would say. I found the connection reliable and stable, and the battery life to be long enough for a full day of gaming. It also works with my gaming PC running Windows 10 which is a very nice bonus.

This is a very nice watch with a great colour scheme - nice matte grey with a striking pink accent and hands. It is quite light, the strap is flexible and it has a large enough range of adjustment to cover every wrist. The hands are easy to read in any light. Recommended.
This is a very stylish compact soap dispenser and steel soap bar set which should look good in any kitchen, backed up by the quality of Joseph Joseph.

The soap dispenser fills easily by removing the pump and takes a whole bottle of your favourite hand wash (I like strawberry laces). Pressing the pump gives a suitable measure of soap, and any drips are caught on the plastic tray beneath. I don‚Äôt know how the steel bar removes the smells of garlic and onions but it does. The whole thing is very neat and effective.

You do need to look after the stainless steel, as residue from the soap can stain it, but otherwise this is a nice looking set which should last for years and save buying a whole new hand wash pump every time you refill.

The pattern on my curtain doesn‚Äôt match the picture, although the colours are the same. The curtain is made from a woven fabric rather than a plastic sheet, so the curtain looks a lot better and hangs a lot better than other plastic sheet shower curtains. It is also machine washable so should last a lot longer than the plastic sheet curtains. Attachment is via buttonhole type holes in the top, and I was a bit disappointed to see that there are no rings included to fix this to the pole.

This advent calendar is a good replacement for the cheap cardboard ones we usually get for the kids. It looks pretty both when it is lit and when it is unlit. The scene is suitably festive yet not too gaudy and makes a nice centrepiece for the season.

The downsides are that it is made of very thin laser-cut plywood. It certainly isn‚Äôt very durable. The drawers are on the small side, so if you are expecting to have a treat for every member of the family then you will need to find some very small treats.
Overall though, this is a nice advent calendar that looks good and does the job, even though it is a bit flimsy and the drawers are on the small side.

This product comes in a very attractive, but somewhat oversized gift box. Several members of my family have tried this set for a couple of weeks, following the instructions to the letter, and each one of them has reported that the results were average. Skin did feel clean and soft, but no more so than when they used their regular products. So overall it is a nice set, but the results were average.

There is very little to fault with this set. It comes with two masks and two sets of earplugs in a carrying case. The mask is made of silk which is very soft and comfortable and effectively covers my eyes and blocks out light. The earplugs are of a memory foam type and do a good job of blocking out sound.
All in all, this is a good set.
My daughter I saw always on a time me to not use soap to wash my face, and I have a beard so this seemed like a good product to use for the job.

The dispenser gives me enough for washing my face and beard with one pump, and the product feels rich and has a nice cedarwood smell. It produces a decent amount of foam, but not too much, and doesn‚Äôt sting if you get it in your eyes. After use, my skin feels clean and soft, as does my beard. If I am going to shave then the bristles are softer and shaving causes less irritation. I haven‚Äôt tried it on my hair as it seems to be a bit expensive to use as shampoo.
I now use this every two or three days, as washing every day causes my beard to go a bit flyaway.

From the Dead Sea Scrolls to Harry Potter, this book covers a good selection of some of the most significant books written so far. It tells the story of writing and creating the books with lots of great illustrations and photos. If you are interested in books, want to get your children into books, or just like coffee table books which you can dip in and out of, then this is an excellent book.

Sugru is a very versatile handy thing to have around any house. You open up one of the little packs and mound it into whatever shape you require and after a number of hours it sets into a firm rubber. I have used it to repair broken plastic and rubber handles, to improve or fix strain relief bits on cables, add non-slip things to slippy surfaces, make hooks to hold cables, and many other things. There are literally hundreds of uses for this around the house, garage, and car. I always keep some in the fridge (it has an expiry date and apparently lasts longer if you keep it cold).
We use this as a doorstop, but it is very well made and comfortable in the hands with a rubber base to protect the floor.
The LED is quite hard to see, but otherwise this is a good charger that works well with my Galaxy S8+ through a case.

The case fits the phone snugly and the cover snaps closed firmly to protect the screen from drops without adding too much thickness. The cover also holds open with the magnetic catch. Ports are easily accessible with the cover open or closed, and the recess actually makes finding the fingerprint scanner easier. The feel is a lot less slippery than the original phone. Overall I'm very happy with this case.

This is a cable that feels durable and comes with an included velcro-type cable tidy. You will see from the photos (the Bqeel has the cable tidy visible on the right) that performance is equal to the stock Samsung cable and allows for my Galaxy S8+ to fast charge. Recommended.
These bulbs are very compact but produce a good amount of crisp white light. They do get a little warm around the base, but no more so than other brands of LED bulbs. Recommended.

A very comfortable and reasonably lightweight set of ear defenders which do a very good job of filtering out noise whilst still allowing a reasonable amount of voice through so you can hear someone talking loudly.
On the face of it, this is a strip of slightly bendy metal with a bit of padding. However, the whole is so much more than the sum of the parts.

I bought this after watching a couple of teardown channels on YouTube as I like fixing my own stuff when I can. Previously I used a screwdriver, kitchen knife, or anything else I could find lying around. This often caused damage to the casing being opened. With my new spudger, I can open almost any plastic casing more easily and without causing anywhere near the damage I caused before. It bends where it needs to and is stiff where appropriate. The soft parts prevent it from digging into your hands and there are different angles for various casings.
It comes attached to a card which shows how to open various common Apple products, but I would suggest having a search to find out the best techniques.

This set of lights does add a bit of ambiance to any TV. They stick well and are long enough to fit around the back of my 49-inch TV. The remote works well even with the sensor behind the telly and allows a good selection of colors. If the lights were a bit brighter then the set would get five stars.

The pull out map could have been made of higher quality paper - I doubt it would even last a day - and the information is time limited, so expect to buy a current version every few years. But otherwise this is a very useful and informative guide for the traveller to get the best out of a visit to the capital.
I have been doing DIY for 20 plus years without one of these, and now that I have it I wondered how I managed without!
This square is very well made and easy to use. The markings are clear and easy to read, and the material it is made from is very sturdy.
A slight moan is that the distances are all in inches, but it is degrees which is important here and they are universal.

This grinds pot is low enough to sit under the basket of your espresso machine when not in use. It is made of good quality materials and performs exactly as advertised. The rubberised bar prevents damage to the basket whilst the non-stick interior means that it is easy to clean. I would have liked the bar to be removable for deep cleaning, but otherwise this is just the job.
This product does exactly what it promises. The display is clear and it seems to be accurate and responsive.

Considering the size of this speaker, about the size of an apple, the sound quality is good. Very good high and mid range, with an acceptable bass which can be improved a little depending which surface you place the speaker on. It is loud enough to fill a bedroom or for background in an office, but would struggle outdoors.

The instructions are in picture format, but reasonably easy to understand. The device is easy to use, with voice prompts and flashing LEDs. A play / pause / answer phone button is on the front of the speaker along with volume up and down. The microphone works well for hands free calling. At five hours the battery life is almost good enough to last a whole day. It pairs very quickly and reliably with my Samsung phone.

I now have this permanently on my desk as the sound quality is head and shoulders above that from the speaker on my phone. If it was water or splash proof then it would get five stars, but for what I am using it then it does the job very well.

We use these tablets on our whites at a standard 40 degree wash. Cleaning power is good, but some stubborn stains such as grass or dried in food will need pre-treatment with a stain removing stick. The Febreeze smell is subtle and gets swamped by the fabric softener. Otherwise these are a good performing general washing tablet for all laundry.

I have been washing my coloured work clothes with these tablets at 40 degrees for a year or so and have definitely noticed that the colour remains for longer than with standard bio tablets. Stain removal is generally good on standard coloured cotton cycle, although for some oily food stains I have had to pre-treat with a stain remover bar. Recommended.

This aerial does let me watch digital TV 15 miles exactly from the transmitter, and works through a stone wall. However inside is not fixed very well, so every time my subwoofer puts out a bassy note the aerial buzzes quite loudly. I have tried damping with rubber, but the noise is there all the time. If I move the aerial well away from the telly it stops, but then I have cable trailing across the room.
This is another high quality low price item from the Amazon Basics range. A set of three suitcases which should be large enough for most family holidays.

Each case has the same extending handle, durable wheels and handy pockets and pouches in the liner. The opening is via zips which are again of a good quality. There is a further zip to give you a couple more inches of space should you come home with more than you left. The plastic material feels durable yet is quite light considering the size of these cases. And they all stack into each other for storage. The handles are a good length and the wheels allow for pulling across a smooth surface - either upright on all four or tilted on two. There are also carrying handles on the top and side and feet opposite to allow the cases to sit upright in different orientation.

My only slight reservation is that the feet seem a bit exposed, and I am not totally convinced that they would stand up to repeated airline baggage stresses. Time will tell and I will update if required.

This wok is a little bit smaller than my usual wok, but it still has room enough for a three or four person stir-fry. It heats up very well on my induction hob, and the non-stick means that it is a breeze to use and even more of a breeze to clean. Nothing sticks to it, even sticky sauce can be wiped off after use. The handles are riveted firmly and the coating is incredibly hard wearing - we have had a frying pan covered in the same ceramic non stick for a few years now and it is still as good as new.

Fits in all of our car seats and effectively protects the upholstery from wet and muddy dogs. The dogs don't mind sitting on it and certainly prefer it to being in the boot. The only negative side is that the webbing is fairly cheap and is starting to slightly fray around the edges, but otherwise this is a very good product for the price.

The bits are hard to get out of the in-handle holder but otherwise this is a very good general purpose screwdriver to have in the kitchen drawer or tool belt. The shaft is removable to make it into a bit of a stubby screwdriver for those hard to reach places.

Love it. I now have two of these and one Echo Dot spread around the house. The whole family now use them for music, controlling our Phillips Hue lights, calendar, trivia, converting measurements, timers, schedules, reminders, news... The list goes on and on. Sound quality is good too.
A genuine pack of coils which produce a good amount of vapour with no after taste. Each one lasts me a couple of weeks of fairly decent use.

This pan is quite a bit smaller than I expected but as it turns out perfect for several reasons. Firstly it is ideal for cooking one egg, or making a bun sized filler like a burger or similar. Secondly because it is small, durable and very easy to clean it is going in my walking kit to pair up with my gas stove for my outdoor cooking. It heats up evenly and is durable and very easy to clean as well as being not too heavy.

These tablets do a good job of cleaning and are suited for those with sensitive skin as the amount of harsh chemicals is limited. I found that stubborn stains needed a warmer than 30 degree wash, and the most stubborn grease on cotton stains needed pre-treatment with a stain stick. We recommend these for delicate fabrics as well as delicate skin.

A very concise guide to building regulations in England and Wales. Well laid out with clear explanations and illustrations and a thorough contents and index. If the regulation isn't in here then the book normally gives a clear indication of where to go to find it.
A really good lightweight (ish) cook set which fits well on to my gas stove. Durable and easy to keep clean. The mugs are just the right size and insulated to keep your drink warm when outdoors.
A good strong stainless buckle for paracord projects. Very well machined these will hold a huge amount of weight. Took a week or so to arrive from China but worth the wait.

These do the job. Cut and melt the ends of the paracord and it will screw right in and hold very firmly. The metal is very thick and allows you to work the cord through awkward materials such as leather (make holes first).

We love this fire pit. The metal is thick enough so that the pit keeps its shape well, and once it heats up it stays hot for a good amount of time. The pit is large enough in diameter and height to accommodate a decent fire. It looks really good when the fire is burning. The handles are very sturdy when you need to carry it around, and the supplied rod for removing the cover is likewise very strong and durable. We are very happy with this.
Very good quality and very long cable. Charges iPhone and iPad at the same speed as the stock cables. The bright woven finish is durable and makes the cable easy to find.
These slats were perfect for repairing a broken bed. They are a little bit thicker than the ones already on the (budget) bed but fit perfectly.

Mine arrived missing the feet. As it was too difficult to return due to my location I made some out of stuff I had lying around the shed. In use the rail produces a good amount of heat and dries the towels effectively.
A good bright light and lasts for a good few hours on the lower setting. The plastic is thick and the fasteners hold everything at the required angle.

I'm a big fan of Stanley products. This one does the job well and keeps my beer cold and fizzy at barbecues and outdoor events. The only thing that does annoy me a bit is that the lid stays at about forty five degrees when open so does get in your face a bit when you are drinking. But otherwise this is a great product and certainly a talking point.

Very simple white embossed wax melt warmer. Simple to set up literally straight out of the box and plug in. Added bonus is that there is an on/off switch on the cable so no need to constantly keep plugging in or out. I liked that this is smaller than some of the Yankee Candle versions as it takes up less room. Heated up wax melt very quickly and gave off strong throw. It says not to keep this unit on for more than 2-3 hours and I did make sure to turn it off then as although the dish is well made, its my opinion that its not quite as thick as some of the yankee versions and wouldn't want it to overheat. Otherwise excellent and the price makes this very attractive.
Update: 01/11/17.....this burner is so good I have just bought a 2nd one

This is a very nice bronzing compact. Unfortunately mine was a broken compact on the outside of the box as was cracked but the powder inside is intact and is totally gorgeous. A beautiful gentle bronzer with a little golden sheen or sparkle, I have very pale skin and was a little unsure of how this would work for me in the compact as looked quite dark. But when it goes on its perfect......I really do like the healthy natural glow this bronzer allows and I would recommend to anyone that wants just a warm gentle colour. I would expect this to last a long time as a little goes a long way!

A small wind chime, perfect for hanging in my bedroom at the window and catches the breeze beautifully with a very gentle tinkling light sound....I love it!! The Rose quartz is excellently pretty and I love that the wood at the top of the chimes has also been painted pink to match. Very pretty!

The quality of St Eval candles is top notch, this is an extremely large candle, a real statement maker and one to place on the coffee table with pride. The candle fragrance on cold (unlit) is strong and can be noticed around the room and when lit gives a fantastic throw in the room and other rooms beyond, as the fragrance throws well. I love St Eval as they are a soy candle which means that they burn easily and well....a few hours lit and this candle pools beautifully and will last a long time. Cant recommend this company enough, they are truly excellent quality.

Nice quality candle! Deep orangey red candle wrapped in thick paper to protect until used. I placed on a candle plate, removed paper, the fragrance is incredible from the candle, its a really sherbetty zesty cranberry with a backdrop of the gingery tone as the under fragrance.. which is great for the Autumn/Winter time. The candle was easy to light and burnt lovely, taking the wax pool quite away across the candle itself. You should aim to burn these candles for 2-3 hours at a time this way you avoid the 'tunnelling' of the candle when you have a small pool in the centre of the candle that doesn't expand across ....... this will shorten the life of your candle rendering it difficult to light later on. If you burn 2-3 hours then your candle has enough time to burn across which then makes the burn even and you get the most out of your candle. If you burn for longer then you risk the mishap of your candle by bulging the wax out of the initial candle shape. When burning this candle has a really good throw and can be smelt in other rooms around the house from it. Quality is second to none with this brand and I would recommend them and this candle in a heartbeat!

Having not used this brand for a while I was happy to give this product a go. Nice little compact of colour, no applicator but the compact is full of of the product so I think we can forgive that as long as you have a brush or applicator to use with this. You get alot of product for the money I think. The eye colour is Slate that I am trying and its supposed to be a 'nude' type colour, which in the palette it did not look at all, it looked darker but when applied it is very delicate in colour and muted and works well for everyday use. The eyeshadow is very soft to apply and gives good coverage without a huge amount being used, it lasted well on my eyes which I use a primer on first. I would recommend this product and would also recommend the colour to anyone looking for a soft gentle 'nude' type of day wear look. Top marks for this very affordable little compact.

I enjoyed this book, its a cosy drama that is very inoffensive, fun and gently washes over you. I do have to confess to enjoying a lighter read especially at bedtimes, I struggle with sleep at the moment so I always look for a book to read at bedtime to help lull me and this kind of light reading (yes I know its a murder story) is just the ticket! I was drawn in very quickly and I enjoyed the story fold out. Its a nice read and would recommend to anyone who enjoys a cosy village drama, like Agatha Raisin. Agatha Christie this is definitely not, but why should it be its a genre of its own

Neat little compact palette which will fit nicely in a make up bag or even your purse/handbag. Very clearly labelled as to each colour to do each separate thing on the front of the palette. Dark circles, redness and 'dull'. I think the redness was the best of the three, however I can't really get excited on how well they did to be honest as I didn't really feel they did anything more amazing than other products that I have been using.....however, on my daughters younger skin they did seem to be more efficient so its got a high rating from us!

Nicely boxed gifts of deodorant and shower wash. Good packaging so will be nice as a little gift and smells fresh and zingy. Easy to use and did a lovely job for a fresh shower. Deodorant fresh and works well!

This is a large item so you will firstly need a good of storage space/area for it or a fair amount of space in a cupboard for it. Its an impressive piece of kit with a detailed instruction booklet which we found easy to read and set machine up with. Its pretty straight forward feed the fruit/veg into the tube and go, it works very quickly and literally eats through the fruit in next to no time, which is quicker than the booklet says to leave machine on for! The juice comes through a spout and into the jug which is provided (you have to place under the spout). We had apple juice in no time and its excellent stuff. I was uneasy as to the going for a juicer for a while, but really glad I did. The downside for me was the sheer size of it and having to clean it.....but thats always going to the case when using a machine like this, quite fiddly to clean up! All in all this machine is really excellent, I have not used a juicer before so cannot compare of older or alternative models but I would not hesitate in recommending this item!

Wow at last I have found the ideal treat!!!! My dogs are super fussy Yorkshire Terriers and a Shih Tzu and we have tried many treats of different kinds, but they are so hard to please with most traditional doggie biscuits being hidden under the sofa once they are given out as they just don't want to know. I have tried alot of different brands and some are ok but frankly its such a limited choice for a good quality non-rawhide treat which has a good flavour and appeals to my dogs......I saw these and took a chance as the price was reduced which made a huge difference to my deciding to purchase as the rrp at the full price is a little bit more than we would normally afford. Glad we went for it, they absolutely loved them and went down a treat, no sickness or bringing treat back up, just lapped up and enjoyed and kept them busy for several minutes actually (they are small dogs) which was an added bonus. They look genuinely good for them and I am happy to treat these on their daily afternoon snack. We would recommend them for trying out and hope that the price stays at a sensible level.

Huge box of lego!!! The theme is popular as its very current Ninjago. Inside the box are the instructions which are complex to put all this together, I would say that this is best to assemble at the older end of the range as its quite complicated and detailed, and alot of patience is required to put it together, it may be good for a younger child to build with an adult and would give that 'bonding' time alot of use!! We had fun doing this and it took us a good few hours but was worth it, my son is at the older age range for this but he is a lego maniac and he got on with the job.....once together it really looks super and is very detailed there are lots of the mini ninjago figures 7 in total and little tools with it too which will give alot of time for play once assembled, the 'drawbridge' shoots out which will go to enhance the imaginative play along with rocks and dynamite sticks too and we also liked the 'guardians' figures which are very exciting...... this makes a lovely playset!! My son will be displaying his along with the other lego marvels that he owns! Truly brilliant kit this is though and would make an excellent gift to a lego/lego ninjago fan!

I'm falling in love with Card-io stamps after seeing them being demonstrated properly. They are very small, and repetition is the key. Leave some areas with just the lighter images and stamp the hops into these areas. It's so easy to create a fantastic card with just a few stamps and three/four ink pads.
Each set of Card-io stamps has a stamping guide on the insert sheet, giving recommended ink colours and initial stamping ideas, which is a very handy feature!

Brilliant designs from Tim Holtz as always, but the production method left a little to be desired.

There are six different but complementary hexagonal patterns (just like you'd see on a Moroccan carpet/rug). You get each design on a larger and a smaller stamp. The larger hexagons are approx. 4cm and the smaller versions are 2.5cm when measured between parallel sides.There are also five border stamps, three of which give you a tassled rug edge and two of which are more general - one with a stylised flower/diamond pattern and the other has a dashed line/sawtooth pattern. These are all 15.5cm long, varying in depth from 4mm to 1.8cm.The red rubber gives the most incredible detail - I used them with Versafine Vintage Sepia ink on kraft card and the result was brilliant - add a couple of brightly-coloured bits and pieces for a great effect.That's the good stuff - and it's really *good* good stuff. The disappointment comes with the final production.They are on a single sheet of red rubber with a grey, cling surface on the reverse.The stamp pattern is printed on the reverse of the stamp. They also went to the trouble of cutting the stamps for you, so that you can pull them out and replace them back into the sheet for storage. Perhaps I got a bad batch, but this should have been caught by quality control:The reverse print of the stamp does not line up with the actual stamp.The die they used to cut out the stamps does not line up with the stamps. All the hexagonal stamps are off-centre, making the stamp and the reverse print both off-centre but in different directions. In two cases, the die had cut part of the actual stamp detail away.These dies are clearly designed to tessellate and so allow you to create a full carpet on your card; this means you need to get twenty or thirty individual images lined up correctly, one-by-one. With the off-centre cutting of the die, and the incorrect positioning of the pattern on the grey backing, it is very difficult to get the stamps to print where you want them to. It is even more of a problem if you are combining different stamps to build up your pattern, switching between stamps as you go. You end up with some shapes overlapping and large gaps between others. The only real solution will be to cut out the stamps again by hand, then try to ignore the print on the reverse when positioning the stamps.

Cut the same outlines in cardstock and stick onto the magnet, then cut the detail die in a contrasting colour and stick that on topUse a non-stick craft sheet over one of those dry wipe/magnet boards and the glue will dry with the magnet perfectly flat.For best results, I then use Pebeo glazing resin (gives a nice, smooth, dome finish) or Ranger Glossy Accents (adds a clear, solid top layer that follows the contours of the detail die)If you want to store dies - these sheets aren't thick enough on their own. The central character is interesting and looks like he is going to get even more interesting, although the requirement for his motives to be purer than his actions is not required. I'll end with a note to the publisher. You will have lost readers for this book by putting the wrong uniforms on the front cover. It won‚Äôt matter to some but history enthusiasts can tell the difference between Peninsular War uniforms and Crimean War. And we will judge you for it.
